title: Brian Molefe's pricey cigar lounge mansion - 'discounted' at R10m
text:
Brian Molefe's pricey cigar lounge mansion - 'discounted' at R10m TMG Digital | 28 February, 2017 18:26 Brian Molefe
Image by: ROBERT TSHABALALA Brian Molefe lives in a mansion in Pretoria that cost him R10 million when he was still chief executive of Eskom‚ which boasts its own cigar lounge and gym. Related News Molefe eases into new life on only R80k Pity about Brian Molefe's stench of corruption that just won’t go away The price tag was 41% less than the R17 million the property was originally advertised for‚ and approximately R4 million less than an offer made on the house by another prospective buyer‚ according to a report on News24‚ quoting an estate agent.
The seller was his friend and former Public Investment Corporation (PIC) colleague‚ Tshepo Mahloele‚ and the deal was made in January last year‚ the report said.
Molefe was sworn in as an MP on Thursday last week‚ amid widespread speculation that he is to be appointed as a member of President Jacob Zuma’s Cabinet.
He resigned as chief executive of Eskom late in 2016 after being mentioned by former public protector Thuli Madonsela in her State of Capture report‚ which indicated that his relationship with the Gupta family warranted further investigation because of concerns over coal contracts.
